body:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.

This is not an issue but I can't find any information about what's the purpose and usage for this variable:
$IsCoreCLR.

This is not event included in the PowerShell Help documentation.
It's excluded from the "About_Automatic_Variables" help doc.

So, all other $Is* are self-explanatory!

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Get-Variable Is*

Name                           Value
----                           -----
**IsCoreCLR                      True**
IsLinux                        False
IsMacOS                        False
IsWindows                      True

Get-Help About_Automatic_Variables

```
Help document has no information about any of the $Is* variables.

$Psver

----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.7> $PSVersionTable

----                           -----

WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This is a new one for PSCore6.  Originally, we weren't committed to only supporting CoreCLR so there was a possibility of a FullCLR version.  I'm actually not sure if there's still value in having this and perhaps we should remove it.  cc @daxian-dbw @joeyaiello

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: Not that there aren't other ways of doing this, but it is useful for pester testing where features of a module are exclusively available in Core or Windows PowerShell. Since `$IsCoreCLR` will not eval `$true` in 5.1, you can easily add a `-pending:$IsCoreCLR` or `-skip:(-not $IsCoreCLR)`

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: Agreed. It's not a strong argument for keeping it, but I grew fond of it. 😄

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I agree that we should remove `$IsCoreCLR` before RTM.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee discussed this and agrees there is no value to keep $IsCoreClr so we recommend removing it

comments.author: apetitjean
comments.body: I noticed this variable is still present in the Release Candidate 1. Don't forget to remove it ;-)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Given where we are with RC and headings towards GA and this is really a matter of cleanliness and not a functional issue to keep it (and our tests are using it so changing them to use PSEdition is work), this is going to stay.

title: Missing documentation - What's the purpose of $IsCoreCLR?
